titles: The Confession and execution of the seven prisoners that suffered at Tyburn on Wednesday the 6th of March, 1677/8 at which time were executed William Johnson, Francis Rashfield, another, Hugh Mills, [double brace] a boy, Blanch Oakley, and Joan Griffin : with an account of their behaviour in prison after condemnation, and their discourses to some friends and ministers that visited them.
notes: Imperfect: print show-through with some loss of print.
Reproduction of original in the Union Theological Seminary Library, New York.
